questions.question: When an object spins or rotates, what is the force that acts toward the center of rotation?
What is the difference between centripetal force and centrifugal force for a rotating object?
questions.answer: Centripetal force is an actual force acting toward the center of rotation. Centrifugal force is an apparent force acting away from the center of rotation.
questions.distractor_1: Centripetal force is an apparent force acting away from the center of rotation. Centrifugal force is an actual force acting toward the center of rotation.
questions.distractor_2: Centripetal force causes objects to rotate clockwise.Centrifugal force causes objects to rotate counterclockwise.
questions.distractor_3: Centripetal force causes objects to rotate counterclockwise.Centrifugal force causes objects to rotate clockwise.
